benchmark_details.name: MMReview
benchmark_details.overview: MMReview is a comprehensive benchmark for peer review generation that spans multiple disciplines and modalities, including multimodal content and expert-written review comments for 240 papers across 17 research domains within four major academic disciplines: Artificial Intelligence, Natural Sciences, Engineering Sciences, and Social Sciences.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) in academic peer review across different modalities and disciplines.

data.source: Academic papers from publicly accessible peer review platforms and open review comments.
data.annotation: Curated peer review comments and outcomes, verified by experts.

methodology.calculation: Computed metrics involved comparing model outputs to human-generated reviews across multiple tasks designed within the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Model performance is interpreted based on scoring consistency with human reviewers and the quality of generated reviews.
methodology.validation: Validated through comprehensive evaluation across various LLMs and review tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of performance across various research domains and input modalities is included in the benchmark evaluation.
